title: For Sale:  1944 Mosin Nagant Ex-Sniper Rifle
postcontent: 1944 ishevsk manufactured mosin nagant ex-sniper. It has a laminate stock with all STAMPED matching numbers, it includes all the accessories (bayonet, ammo pouch, sling, cleaning kit). Very good shiny bore. Honestly the nicest 91-30 I have seen. It is a 6+ on the mosin rarity scale. Also before you message me to ask why the bolt isn't bent here you go... at some point in the rifle's life it was sent in to the factory for refurbishment which is evident by the square with the line through it above the date. during the refurbishment process the scope was removed and the holes were filled in which you can see in the 3rd picture posted. they removed the original stock and replaced it with a really nice laminate stock and last but not least, they removed the turn down bolt and replaced it with a straight bolt that they stamped to match the rest of the numbers on the rifle(not electro penciled or crossed out) and that is why it is considered an 'ex-sniper' and not a 'sniper' rifle. the rifling looks great and has not been counter bored. It is a very clean gun inside and out. if you have any doubts or questions you can find all the answers you need at 7.62x54r dot net. Thanks and if you need more pics or have any questions that i haven't answered feel free to message me. Also 'NO I WILL NOT TAKE $175!!!' so please don't bother me with lowball offers. Thanks

title: For Sale:  New PMAG 40 round AR/M4 GEN M3, 5.56x45 Magazines
location: Downtown Wichita - Central Business District, Wichita, Kansas
postcontent:
The next-generation PMAG 40 GEN M3 is a 40-round 5.56x45 NATO (.223 Remington) polymer magazine for AR15/M4 compatible weapons. Along with expanded feature set and compatibility, the GEN M3 incorporates new material technology and manufacturing processes for enhanced strength, durability, and reliability to exceed rigorous military performance specifications.

While the GEN M3 is optimized for Colt-spec AR15/M4 platforms, modified internal and external geometry also permits operation with a range of additional weapons such as the HK® 416/MR556A1/M27 IAR, British SA-80, FN® SCAR™ MK 16/16S, and others.

The PMAG 40 GEN M3 features a long-life stainless steel spring, four-way anti-tilt follower and constant-curve internal geometry for reliable feeding, and simple tool-less disassembly to ease cleaning.

In addition, a redesigned bolt catch notch in the rear of the magazine provides increased bolt catch clearance, while an over-travel stop on the spine helps ensure the magazine will not over-insert on compatible weapons. Low profile ribs and new aggressive front and rear texture gives positive control of the GEN M3 in all environments, and a paint pen dot matrix has been added to the bottom panel of the body to allow easy marking by the end user for identification. The new, easy to disassemble flared floorplate aids extraction and handling of the magazine while providing improved drop protection, but is slightly slimmer than before for better compatibility with tight double and triple magazine pouches. An included pop-off Impact/Dust Cover can optionally be used to minimize debris intrusion and protect against potential damage to the top cartridge during storage and transit.

Made in U.S.A.

title: For Sale:  COLT AUTOMATIC 25 acp
postcontent: This is an amazing little 1911. It is exactly like a colt 1911 that has been shrunk down to less than 5" in length. These were only manufactured for 2 years, 1970 & 1971. There were other 22 and 25 models that were made in other years, they were called vest pistols, pocket pistols, etc., many of those were not actually built by Colt, but did bare their name. This one was manufactured by COLT, and you can definitely tell . To hold this in your hand the first thing that surprises you is the weight, it's heavier than you would think and that's because of the way it is built. It's construction is heavy and perfect. This is not a toy like every other small hand gun, this is the real thing. This is like the Rolex of the small hand guns. It's in fabulous shape for it's age, with the blueing still in perfect condition on 95% of the Colt. The slide mechanism is precise and smooth. The trigger hammer can be pulled back to fire that way and it also clicks into position like the day it was new and everything about this gun knocks the socks off of just about all current hand guns that are manufactured today. This is a very collectable hand gun and it will be extremely hard to find another one in this condition and impossible to find at this price. Now this will make a great carry pistol, you can put it anywhere.

title: For Sale:  Sawwed off break barrel
postcontent: I'm trying to sell my break barrel Winchester Model 70. I didn't saw it down but I bought it that way at a LEGAL 18 1/4 inch barrel length with about 40" overall (I measured it but it's way over legal limit so I don't recall) As of currently it's having a little problem where the extractor will allow a shell to fall past it, making it impossible to close or remove the shell. All it would take to fix is a punch set and some time but I have neither right now and with my 870 project mostly done I could use the cash to get my receiver drilled and tapped. When I bought this gun it had no finish left and started to rust so I sanded everything down and sandblasted it and gave it a solid paintjob that has kept the rust at bay and gives it a rather cool look. Also the front hand guard is loose so it has to be held on with tape during firing, this isn't a safety issue it's just how the shotgun breaks down for storage (doesn't have a screw like the newer models). Because of these issues I'm only asking 80 dollars for it to the first person willing to take it off my hands. It's a lot of fun, operationally solid with a strong hammer and firing pin, and the ejector THROWS shells out. MUST have an Ohio drivers license and a CHL is a huge perk. Since I'm asking so little I won't be willing to travel that far to sell it.

title: For Sale/Trade:  .223 Savage varmint with or w/o vortex scope
postcontent:
I would like to buy some new hunting gear so I am putting my .223 bolt gun up for sale.  This is a great gun.  I have a couple hundred rounds through it and it shoots great.  I am averaging .75" groups with some barely developed reloads and just over .75" with super cheap remington umc 50 gr at 100 yards.  With a bit more work developing loads this gun should be even more accurate.  The gun is in like new condition other than a thick kydex cheekrest I made for it which really helps align your eye with the scope.  The rifle is a savage 11 varmint with the target accutrigger and a detachable magazine.  It has a vortex crossfire II 4-12 x 50 adjustable objective scope on it mounted in burris zee signature rings with the offset insert kit.  It also has a wheeler engineering scope level on it.  The scope is leveled to the reciever.  This gun was broken in right.  1 shot, clean, repeat for ten shots then 3 shots, clean, repeat for 30 shots.  The bore looks great.  I would rather sell, but if you happen to have something I am interested in I might be willing to trade.  I am currently interested in a light weight big game hunting rifle, 45-70 or 30-30 lever rifel (I would also consider other 7mm or larger lever rifles), 44 mag or larger caliber revolver, new or like new long range range finder.  I am also currently looking for a nice backpackable tipi or tarp with stove.  I would have to be really interested to add money, but it would be possible for the right trade.  However, I am willing to entertain trade plus cash on your end.

here is the rundown of what everything cost:
savage 11 varmint .223: $600
Vortex crossfire II scope 4-14 BDC scope: $220 plus shipping
Zee signature rings with offset alignment kit: $55 plus shipping
wheeler scope level $35 plus shipping
I sold the crappy scope that came with the rifle for $50

Total: $860  I will sell it all for $550 or just the rifle for $350

All laws apply, local sales only

title: For Sale/Trade:  Savage 116 Bear Hunter 300 win. mag with vortex 4-16 x 50 scope rifle only or package
postcontent:
I bought this rifle because I wanted a heavy barrel target rifle.  This is a pretty sweet rifle, it has a stainless fluted mid-weight barrel with factory adjustable muzzle break.  It has a drop floor plate magazine, a nice breaking accutrigger, the jeweled bolt and the accustock.  I added a warne 20 moa 1 pc scope mount, warne maxima rings, and a vortex crossfire II 4-16 x 50 adjustable objective scope with the bdc reticle.  I have only fired 20 rounds and I break my rifles in right.  Fire clean, fire clean for the first 20 rounds.  I have never had a rifle shoot accurately during this period as cleaning leaves an inconsistent surface for the bullet to travel accross.  However, this rifle appears to shoot right around 1 moa even given this inconsistency.  It should shoot really great.  However, it is really not the rifle I want.  I am looking for something with a bit longer and heavier barrel.

Here is the rundown on what I have into this setup:

Rifle $830
20 moa One piece base $120
Warne Maxima rings $55

title: For Sale:  RARE: Sig Sauer P938 BLACKOUT edition, laser, extras!
postcontent:
COMPLETE CONCEALED CARRY PKG: custom holsters, mags, laser, everything you need!

Sig Sauer P938 9mm mini 1911-style handgun in the hard-to-find BLACKOUT version.  The entire gun is finished in no-nonsense black, from the slide to the frame right down to the Hogue rubber grips, embedded with the Sig Sauer logo. This is not the same as the regular BRG version on Sig's website; this version has several upgrades including the slide serrations at the front. The single action only is a trigger pull far preferable to the competitors' DAO pistols of similar size.

This full package is ready for summer as your new carry weapon, and includes everything you’ll need all in one:

- Sig P938 Blackout (MSRP $836)
- HBE Leatherworks Pro TL (thin line) tuckable custom leather IWB holster ($115)
- Multiholsters custom IWB Kydex holster ($82.95)
- Galco Ankle Lite ankle holster ($78.95)
- THREE magazines: two extended, 7-rd mags and one flush 6 rounder (MSRP $46 each)
- Sig Sauer PX38-TGL Trigger Guard Laser (MSRP $189)


In total with taxes and fees, I have well over $1400 into this package. The gun is in excellent condition with precisely 280 rounds down the pipe (I’m meticulous and keep the boxes). It has been very well maintained and consistently cleaned. Also comes with original box. Additionally, I don't smoke and no pets... gun still looks brand new.

The HBE Leatherworks holster is the ultimate in craftsmanship. The top grain leather custom Pro TL (which stands for thin-line) is a tuckable, inside the waistband holster specifically made and molded for the P938. His genius design of setting the belt hook off to one side allows for a very thin profile on your waist that simply will not print. His work is fantastic; google some reviews or check out his site. I highly recommend.

The Kydex IWB holster from Multiholsters.com is also very comfortable, and while not as thin as the Pro TL, it is thin (made from a solid sheet of .08 Kydex) and allows for two distinct advantages: a much quicker draw and re-holster, thanks to the Kydex, and I paid extra to have the mold made for the gun with the laser fitted, so you have both options. Again, the Kydex holster is molded for the P938 WITH the laser attached (though it works flawlessly without, as well). Plus you can sweat all over and not worry about the expensive leather!

Then of course, Sig Sauer’s own Trigger Guard Laser assembly is quick to install and remove and allows for some excellent practice at the range, or assurance as you carry.

My new favorite carry method is the Galco Ankle Lite. The sheepskin on the inside feels great, and the pocket fits the pistol perfectly so it’s not banging and flopping around. If it’s cold enough to wear jeans, my HBE holster goes in the drawer and I always carry in the ankle holster—and forget that I’m wearing it!

Lastly, three mags, including two of the coveted pinky-extender floorplate 7 rounders.

All in all, this is the ideal, complete, and most excellent carry package you can find. I love the feel of this gun and I’ve never had a single FTF or FTE with any of the ammo I’ve run through it. Only reason I’m selling is I couldn’t convince my wife to step up from her .380 P238 and match mine, so I’m considering acquiescing (as long as she’s willing to carry!) and downsizing to a P238. 

No trades. FTF in VA only. Will not ship. Must be 21, have valid photo ID, be willing to sign a simple bill of sale and be legally able to purchase a pistol.

I will consider trades or deals but ONLY in the following: ammunition (9mm, .357 magnum, .380 auto, .223/5.56, .40, .22 LR), a Sig P238 SAS, a Springfield 1911 TRP, a S&W 360 PD, or a Kimber Micro CDP (or possibly another Kimber).
